title: Do you know this letterpress font?
content:
[http://www.bleisetzer.de/tagebuch/typo-quizz-ii.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/www.bleisetzer.de/tagebuch/typo-quizz-ii.html "http://www.bleisetzer.de/tagebuch/typo-quizz-ii.html")

The text is not important. I need the name of the font.

Georg
author: Bleisetzer

comments.content:
Hello Georg,  
I don’t know the name of the font, sorry.  
But just in case you are interested in similar digital faces, here are a few:  
 [Goodfellow](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/goodfellow/)  
 [Rubens](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/rubens/)  
 [Fiorello](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atfiorello-condensed/)  
 [Macbeth](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/www.linotype.com/de/141682/macbethregular-schrift.html)

Florian

The Offenbach Klingspor Museum knows a "Zeitungs Grotesk" from Bauersche:  
 [http://www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftgiessereien/Bau...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftgiessereien/Bauer/Bauersche.pdf "http://www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftgiessereien/Bauer/Bauersche.pdf")  
Seems it was designed by Otto Weisert:  
 [http://www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftgiessereien/Wei...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftgiessereien/Weisert/OWeisert.pdf "http://www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftgiessereien/Weisert/OWeisert.pdf")

The name is rather generic ("Newspaper Sans" for the non-German-speaking world) and there may have been more than one font design under that name.

Perhaps this link can get you further:  
 [http://dbs.hab.de/wbb/entrysearch.php?docID=28442&PHPSESSID=5ceb9bddb306...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/dbs.hab.de/wbb/entrysearch.php?docID=28442&PHPSESSID=5ceb9bddb3064aeec2455f44effe472b "http://dbs.hab.de/wbb/entrysearch.php?docID=28442&PHPSESSID=5ceb9bddb3064aeec2455f44effe472b")

(Depends on how close you live to Wolfenbüttel.)

Andreas

First of all:  
Thanks a lot for your support.

@ Florian  
No, I just need it to classify this font for the font collection of lead fonts on my website: [http://www.bleisetzer.de/schriftensammlung.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/www.bleisetzer.de/schriftensammlung.html "http://www.bleisetzer.de/schriftensammlung.html")

@ Andreas  
Thanks for the links. The problem: They show some data, but no scan of the font.

I found a "Zeitungs Grotesk" on [http://www.global-type.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557/http:/www.global-type.org/ "http://www.global-type.org/") from Lars Kähler:

[URL=http://img291.imageshack.us/i/59720192.jpg/][IMG]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/7360/59720192.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

It is very close, but my font is more bold, I guess.  
Well.. we'll see...

Georg  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
„Ich bin ein Preuße, kennt Ihr meine Farben...“

I got it:

Zeitungsgrotesk schmalhalbfett  
Bauersche Gießerei  
Erstguß 1906  
Hausschrift

Thank you for your support.

Georg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130221011557im_/http:/typophile.com/files/zg_5483.jpg)
  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
„Ich bin ein Preuße, kennt Ihr meine Farben...“
